{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3570209,"name":"","username":"CalculusPenguin","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/838e76/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T16:47:23.535Z","cooked":"

Hello,

Is there a way to change the drive motor idle mode to coast when using YAGSL? We would like to use a different idle mode for certain portions of the match.

Thank you.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T16:47:23.535Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":51,"readers_count":50,"score":30.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":497133,"topic_slug":"drive-motors-to-coast-with-yagsl","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":64438,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Software Lead"},"post_url":"/t/drive-motors-to-coast-with-yagsl/497133/1","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570221,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T17:04:08.649Z","cooked":"

I know you can access the individual motor controllers like this

SparkMax driveMotor = (SparkMax)swerveDrive.getModules()[0].getDriveMotor().getMotor();

I assume you can set the idleMode from there? Im unsure when/how often YAGSL resets the idle mode but I would assume just on startup?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2025-03-27T17:04:08.649Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":42,"readers_count":41,"score":23.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":497133,"topic_slug":"drive-motors-to-coast-with-yagsl","display_username":"Owen Busler","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23320,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/drive-motors-to-coast-with-yagsl/497133/2","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3570237,"name":"Paul Rensing","username":"prensing","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/prensing/{size}/65820_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-27T17:18:45.140Z","cooked":"

The typical YAGSL code has the method Swerve::setMotorIdleMode to set brake/idle mode.

However, you should definitely check carefully if you are switching this during a match. The documentation for a TalonFX (Kraken or Falcon motors) notes that setting the “neutral mode”, as they call it, is a configuration operation and it is blocking. That means that it can disrupt the control signals to the motors while it is happening. I have not checked for SparkMaxes.
